page.title: 03FYLINGDALES GAZETTEER
page.content: Tourist Information. At the bottom of Bay Bank on the right hand side is a shop called Rainbow. The owners answer questions and there are brochures containing information about places to visit. Walks. There are numerous walks around this area leading up to the moors, along the cliff top, along the beach and many more. There is also a long distance walk from St. Bees to Robin Hoods Bay. The Sea.The only place to swim is in the sea. Most of the time it is inadvisable because of strong currents rocks under the water and tangleweed which wraps round your body. Diving is a popular sport and there are lots of wrecks to be explored in the Bay. Bird Watching. On the cliff many sea birds can be seen with occasional rare species.
